means: 极端流于感伤的音乐，伤感主义

自从1929年德国的施马尔茨(SchmaltZ)发明了用光杠杆进行放大的表面轮廓记录仪后,人们就一直致力于表面质量检测技术的研究,从此 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1930s: from Yiddish shmaltz, from German Schmalz 'dripping, lard'

entry.tran: (戏剧、电影或书籍)过分感伤，煽情
entry.def: If you describe a play, film, or book as schmaltz, you do not like it because it is too sentimental.

means.word_mean: 1. (Yiddish) excessive sentimentality in art or music
